medical_history.chief_complaint: Nausea, vomiting, and worsening left-sided abdominal pain.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The symptoms began approximately two days before the visit, with the left-sided abdominal pain described as 'dull' and ongoing for the last one to two months, worsening three days prior to admission without an inciting event. The patient experienced two episodes of non-bloody nausea and vomiting, and has had chronic right-sided pain since the liver transplant. Additionally, the patient has reported subjective fevers and ongoing diarrhea since the transplant. Chest pain described as 'felt like heartburn' occurred last week but has since resolved. The patient also reports shortness of breath ongoing for 'many months' and short-term memory loss.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Cirrhosis (EtOH, HCV), history of HCC, status post DCD liver transplant, mild acute cellular rejection, COPD, pseudogout, depression, recurrent DVT, history of cardiac arrest secondary to heroin overdose, prior intravenous drug use, prior alcohol use disorder, history of crushed vertebrae with chronic low back pain on OxyContin, left hip and right knee joint issues undergoing corticosteroid injections, restless leg syndrome.
medical_history.family_history: Mother deceased, history of diabetes mellitus and hypertension; father alive, history of congestive heart failure; grandmother deceased from cancer, unknown type. No known history of liver disease or liver cancer in the family.
